article_title: 5 Ways Tribes Can Reduce Taxes On Members In 2016
article_text:
5 Ways Tribes Can Reduce Taxes On Members In 2016

Law360, New York (January 11, 2016, 2:24 PM ET) -- Kathleen M. Nilles



Peter A. Hahn Contrary to popular misconception, individual members of Native American tribes do pay federal income taxes on their income, including on most of the income derived from Native American tribal or reservation sources. Some also pay state income tax on many income sources. Moreover, tribal member income is generally subject to tax at full "ordinary income" rates — not the reduced rates applicable to capital gains or corporate dividends. Many tribal members also have few deductions and limited options for deferring...

article_metadata.description: Recently adopted federal legislation and IRS guidance have provided tribal leaders with new ways to structure tribal programs that can reduce federal and state taxes imposed on individual tribal members, say Kathleen Nilles at Holland & Knight LLP and Pete Hahn, treasurer of the Seminole Tribe of Florida.
